result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M. Armbrust Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Cases 16CM141, 13CF119,14CF54,14CF69 are all concurrent to each other

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Dora Subke  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  There maybe contact to the child when the agent believes it to be appropriate.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. Armbrust Sr.

records.addlTxt: Nothing is owed to us, no judgment added
and stipulation to waive appearance and hearing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.
Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Christopher M. Armbrust, in custody, appeared with Attorney Anne Terrien.
Status conference on September 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 4, 2016 at 09:40 am.

Prosecutor, Richard R. Lewis, and Defendant, Christopher M. Armbrust, appeared by video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Anne Terrien appearing in person, in court.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 09:40 am.
Initial appearance on July 7, 2016 at 11:10 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with  D.M. S. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

Richard Lewis appeared for the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 11:10 am.
